phrases: Ladies and gentlemen, good evening.
On that stormy day that announced the end of spring,
I tremble in silence at these emotions which leak out...
This must be your guest.
Count, if you do not mind, I would like you to join us for dinner after you have met my parents.
Count?
If it is not too much trouble.
Please do.
After all, we owe you our son's life.
Act 4: A Mother's Secrets
To our new friend, the Count of Monte Cristo.
Oh, is that so?
I am embarrassed that you know of the Janina campaign.
The people praise me as a hero,
After all, nothing good ever results from destruction.
No, these idyllic times in which we live were built on the back of sacrifice.
Such is my opinion, at any rate.
I expect that the far corners of the galaxy are echoing...
You honor me by saying so.
Oh, dear, the food was not to your liking?
Not at all.
Please, think nothing of it.
I am in the habit of eating very little.
I cannot say that I do not understand how you feel.
Having advanced in years, I find myself weary of extravagant meals such as this.
In my case, I find lately that I seldom sleep, either.
I am amazed that you have managed to stay healthy.
It is because of these.
Are they some sort of space rations?
In the course of wandering the sea of stars for so long,
Even so, I hope that you would at least eat something...
The thought of neither sleeping nor eating is too sad to bear.
Too sad to bear?
Very well, then.
In that case, perhaps I shall sample this.
Please do.
This taste brings back memories...
Brings back memories?
I once experienced delightful cooking such as this in the south of France.
This is the dish that you have made for as long as I can remember, right, Mother?
Yes.
By any chance, you would not happen to be from Marseilles, would you?
No.
My wife has nothing to do with such a barbaric province.
Is not that right, Mercedes?
Y-Yes...
Oh, really?
What is the matter?
One of my friends is from there.
His name is Maximilien Morrel.
He is a really nice person.
Morrel...
Forgive me if I misspoke.
Please, do not take offense.
That is all right.
Our family traces its roots back to a powerful Catalan family.
This soup has been a specialty of my wife's ever since she was a young girl.
Oh, I see.
So, you and the Countess were childhood friends, then?
Yes, that is right.
Which explains why you seem so close.
I am jealous beyond words.
I had no idea that a man like you could be jealous of anyone, Count.
Yes, of course.
If that person is a man of your father's caliber.
Get the Count something to drink.
His glass is empty.
Please stay for as long as time permits.
Sitting around the table like this, it almost feels as if you are a member of the family.
What a maddening scent this is...
Count?
It is from the muscat grapes.
Are you fatigued?
No, please forgive me for forcing you to eat earlier.
Not at all.
I had always hoped to experience that delicious flavor again.
It was a sublime experience.
It was a simple rustic dish.
But it makes me happy to hear you say so.
Have you heard of this?
There is a saying that goes,
Those who share bread and salt under the same roof become eternal friends.
That is a tradition handed down in Eastern Space, is it not?
Yes.
Which means that we are now friends.
For all eternity.
However, this is not Eastern Space.
It is Paris.
In Paris, everlasting friendship is impossible without the act of sharing bread and salt.
Your soup truly was delicious.
Warm, and yet evocative of past memories.
It is something which gives comfort.
Like a breeze blowing across the Mediterranean Sea.
Count, are you very familiar with Marseilles?
I could say that I am aware of it.
But perhaps I never truly knew it at all.
Infidelity.
Adultery.
Dalliances in the dead of night.
You aristocrats are as energetic as the rumors say.
Spare me your crude comments!
The Count is a friend of mine.
Honestly, you are such a child.
If people could become friends simply by sharing bread and salt,
What are you talking about?
You will understand sooner or later, little boy.
I am most grateful to you for allowing me to experience a day such as today.
Not at all.
I am proud that I had the opportunity to introduce you to my parents.
To introduce a man I admire.
What say you?
I would like to invite you to my residence on the Champs-Elysees in the near future.
I would love to come!
The Count of Monte Cristo was a mysterious man, do not you think?
Yes.
There was a sternness somewhere in him that keeps people at arm's length.
That just means that compared to the Count, the people of Paris are dull.
My...
You might not know this, Mother, but there is more to the world than Paris.
Out beyond the walls, there is a world that is endlessly captivating.
I think you have changed since your journey to Luna.
My journey is just beginning.
Do not go to worlds too far removed from our own.
You should exercise moderation in your association with the Count.
Oh, please, Mother...
You sound just like Franz.
Well, even though he seems more than a little shady,
Not when this family is about to throw its hat into the political arena.
Good grief, why do aristocrats eat like this all the time?
Dinner parties, high tea, balls...
It is probably because they do not have anything else to do.
In other words, if you took away the gluttony, lust, and avarice,
You need to watch your mouth.
Did not you think that their guest today was rather elegant and handsome?
I am not so sure.
He was not very refined.
Maybe, but he had a pretty good vibe going with the mistress under the grapevine trellis.
What, really?
I would always thought that the master was the only man in the world for the mistress.
I think that any society lady would fall for that Count if he worked his mojo on her.
Give it a rest, already!
That was definitely the face of a woman in love.
If you do not stop that, I am going to report you.
Oo, I am so scared...
That is preposterous.
Mother is the last person in the world who would be capable of...
Mother?
Who is in that picture she is looking at?
Do you find me a horrible man?
No.
I will stay at your side for as long as I live.
Even if that means walking down the path to ruin.
It is not we who will be ruined.
I have come home, Father.
What, you are still here?
Hey, do not touch those!
I hate to break it to you, but I have gotten into your father's good graces,
His good graces?
It means that your father is a man like any other.
Give those bad jokes a rest.
Well, setting aside your father for the moment,
What is that supposed to mean?
I mean, she was staring so wistfully at that picture of a young man...
You saw that?
It was definitely a picture of a man.
A man who was not your father.
Oh, I can understand.
If my mother was staring at a picture of some strange man,
That is about enough!
Get out!
Yes, sir!
Eugenie?
I did not know you were here.
Ever the late riser, I see.
Why are you dressed like that?
What is wrong with it?
Skirts just do not work on you.
I did not come here to see you, Albert!
Then do not have me dragged out of bed!
I am the one who had you woken up, Albert.
Is something the matter?
No, madam.
Eugenie is your fiancee, is not she?
I think it is only natural that you should greet her when she is over.
Sure, I suppose.
Um, are you going somewhere?
Oh, we are just going out to do a little shopping together.
Let us go, Madame!
Of course.
That reminds me.
What is this I hear about the Count of Monte Cristo inviting you over?
How did you know that?
I heard about it from Franz.
He said that he and Maximilien were also invited.
They were invited, too?
What is he...
Peppo!
What are you doing?
Oh, hi, Albert!
Do not you Oh, hi! me!
Do not play around with Mother's jewelry!
But they are so pretty!
If my father sees you like that, there will be hell to pay!
Fine, fine.
I will put them back, then.
You are dying to know what is in there, are not you?
It is like your mother's secret treasure is hidden inside.
Impossible.
Oh, there is no such thing as a human being who does not have secrets.
Just like you and I share a certain secret night.
That only happened because I was tricked by you!
If you ever want that lock opened, come tell me anytime.
I specialize in getting into people's drawers.
Stop being crude, and get back to work!
Oh.
Fine.
It cannot be...
Why would Mother have a picture of the Count?
This is ridiculous.
What am I so worried about?
His Excellency General Morcerf!
Ten-hut!
All high and mighty...
How do I look?
Not too strange, I hope?
It looks wonderful on you.
What?
Thank goodness.
You are more upbeat than I expected.
Gee, thanks.
For a visit to the Count's place, that outfit is not quite flamboyant enough, do not you think?
Not flamboyant enough?
Albert?
What in the world are you wearing?
What is wrong with it?
Where do I even begin?
I will never understand the ways of you aristocrats.
Why are you dressed like a pirate?!
Uh, what are you even doing here, Beauchamp?
You do not expect me to miss my chance to get photos of the Count's mansion, do you?
Oh, brother.
And here I had hoped to go there by myself, if at all possible.
That day when I first met you, you made me realize that there is always hope,
I will never forget that lesson.
Hope...
When I was flung out of the Chateau d'lf into the black void of space,
You are sure this is it?
Yep. number thirty, Champs-Elysees.
No doubt about it.
It is a lot more austere than I expected it to be, considering the Count.
I was expecting the sort of place that would drive a commoner into a rage if he saw it.
Early Rococo, huh?
And not Revival, either.
Is not this amazing?
Well, it is a bit too far removed from my world...
Please pardon the delay.
Allow me to show you to the Count.
What the...?
We are going down!
Baptistin, where are we going?
We have stopped!
That is...
Even the floor and columns are gold...
The man has expensive tastes.
Where could he have gotten this much gold?
That is why I think there is something fishy about him.
At this rate, I bet his bed and pillows are going to be solid gold, too.
I would never be able to fall asleep with all this glare.
Hey!
Look at that!
That is...
The sea?
No, wait.
Look at that sky!
It is artificial?
I cannot believe it...
This alone would make one hell of a story.
This is so beautiful...
Wait, I know this view!
That look suits you quite well, Sir Pirate.
Count!
Wha...?
If you do not mind, I would like you to have this, Sir Pirate.
I was given this blade by a certain ship's navigator.
Perhaps it will serve to protect you, as well as to carve a path for you.
When we meet someone,
Next time on Gankutsuou, The Count of Monte Cristo, act 5,
Act 5: Do You Love Your Fiancee?
Bide your time, and hold out hope!
